intro: Cleisostoma ringens, commonly known as the fragrant wax plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Cleisostoma ringens thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its aesthetic appeal and pleasant scent.
